main event: An unconventional aircraft was reported near Haines, Alaska on 8 June 1949, described as a very bright ball of light of a blue-green color, which gradually disappeared with no visible tail or exhaust.
interesting points: The object was observed by experienced pilots and appeared similar to another reported sighting, indicating a pattern of unusual blue-green ball objects traveling at high speeds.
The sighting was recorded as an air-visual observation, with no physical evidence or photographs available.
The object was initially not visible and then observed 70 miles north of Juneau, Alaska, at an altitude of 12,000 feet.
The observers were required to swerve off course to avert collision with the object, indicating the potential proximity of the unidentified aircraft.
Despite differing in some respects, there was noted similarity between this report and another unusual object sighting, suggesting a consistent pattern of sightings of similar objects.
sighted object: very bright ball of light of a blue-green color
witnesses: experienced pilots, former Air Force officer and pilot
